add.description: For a translational addition to the text

addpn.description: For chinese words to be dot underline & underline (DEPRECATED - used nested char@style pn)

b.description: Poetry text stanza break (e.g. stanza break)

bd.description: A character style, use bold text

bdit.description: A character style, use bold + italic text

bk.description: For the quoted name of a book

cd.description: Chapter Description (Publishing option D, e.g. in Russian Bibles)

cl.description: Chapter label used for translations that add a word such as "Chapter"

d.description: A Hebrew text heading, to provide description (e.g. Psalms)

dc.description: Deuterocanonical/LXX additions or insertions in the Protocanonical text

efm.description: Reference to caller of previous footnote in a study Bible

em.description: A character style, use emphasized text style

fdc.description: Footnote text, applies to Deuterocanon only (DEPRECATED - use char@style dc)

fl.description: A footnote label text item, for marking or "labelling" the type or alternate translation being provided in the note.

fm.description: Reference to caller of previous footnote

fq.description: A footnote scripture quote or alternate rendering

fqa.description: A footnote alternate rendering for a portion of scripture text

fr.description: The origin reference for the footnote

fv.description: A verse number within the footnote text

fw.description: A footnote witness list, for distinguishing a list of sigla representing witnesses in critical editions.

h.description: Running header text for a book

h2.description: Running header text, left side of page (DEPRECATED)

h3.description: Running header text, right side of page (DEPRECATED)

iex.description: Introduction explanatory or bridge text (e.g. explanation of missing book in Short Old Testament)

ili.description: A list entry, level 1 (if single level)

ili1.description: A list entry, level 1 (if multiple levels)

im.description: Introduction prose paragraph, with no first line indent (may occur after poetry)

imi.description: Introduction prose paragraph text, indented, with no first line indent

imq.description: Introduction prose paragraph, quote from the body text, with no first line indent

imt.description:
Introduction major title, level 1 (if single level)
Introduction major title, level 1 - (if single level)

imt1.description: Introduction major title, level 1 (if multiple levels)

imt4.description: Introduction major title, level 4 (usually within parenthesis)

imte.description: Introduction major title at introduction end, level 1 (if single level)

imte1.description: Introduction major title at introduction end, level 1 (if multiple levels)

imte2.description: Introduction major title at introduction end, level 2

io.description: Introduction outline text, level 1 (if single level)

io1.description: Introduction outline text, level 1 (if multiple levels)

ior.description: Introduction references range for outline entry; for marking references separately

ip.description:
Introduction prose paragraph
Division or Section introductory paragraph (study Bible)

ipi.description: Introduction prose paragraph, indented, with first line indent

ipq.description: Introduction prose paragraph, quote from the body text

iq.description: Introduction poetry text, level 1 (if single level)

iq1.description: Introduction poetry text, level 1 (if multiple levels)

is.description: Introduction section heading, level 1 (if single level)

is1.description: Introduction section heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)

it.description: A character style, use italic text

jmp.description: For associating linking attributes to a span of text

k1.description: Concordance main entry text or keyword, level 1

k2.description: Concordance main entry text or keyword, level 2

li.description: A list entry, level 1 (if single level)

li1.description: A list entry, level 1 (if multiple levels)

lim.description: An embedded list entry, level 1 (if single level)

lim1.description: An embedded list entry, level 1 (if multiple levels)

lit.description: For a comment or note inserted for liturgical use

liv.description: Structured list entry value 1 content (if single value)

liv1.description: Structured list entrt value 1 content (if multiple values)

m.description: Paragraph text, with no first line indent (may occur after poetry) aka: Paragraph Continuation

mi.description: Paragraph text, indented, with no first line indent; often used for discourse

mr.description: A major section division references range heading

ms.description: A major section division heading, level 1 (if single level)

ms1.description: A major section division heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)

ms2.description: A major section division heading, level 2

ms3.description: A major section division heading, level 3

mt.description: The main title of the book (if single level)

mt1.description: The main title of the book (if multiple levels)

mt2.description: A secondary title usually occurring before the main title

mt3.description: A tertiary title occurring after the main title

mt4.description:
Introduction major title, level 1 (if single level)
A small secondary title sometimes occuring within parentheses

mte.description: The main title of the book repeated at the end of the book, level 1 (if single level)

mte1.description: The main title of the book repeat /ed at the end of the book, level 1 (if multiple levels)

mte2.description: A secondary title occurring before or after the 'ending' main title

nb.description: Paragraph text, with no break from previous paragraph text (at chapter boundary)

no.description: A character style, use normal text

ord.description: For the text portion of an ordinal number

p.description:
Paragraph text, with first line indent
Front or back matter text paragraph, level 1

p1.description: Front or back matter text paragraph, level 1 (if multiple levels)

p2.description: Front or back matter text paragraph, level 2 (if multiple levels)

pb.description: Page Break used for new reader portions and children's bibles where content is controlled by the page

ph.description: Paragraph text, with level 1 hanging indent (if single level) (DEPRECATED - use para@style li#)

ph1.description: Paragraph text, with level 1 hanging indent (if multiple levels)

ph2.description: Paragraph text, with level 2 hanging indent

ph3.description: Paragraph text, with level 3 hanging indent

pi.description: Paragraph text, level 1 indent (if single level), with first line indent; often used for discourse

pi1.description: Paragraph text, level 1 indent (if multiple levels), with first line indent; often used for discourse

pi2.description: Paragraph text, level 2 indent, with first line indent; often used for discourse

pi3.description: Paragraph text, level 3 indent, with first line indent; often used for discourse

pro.description: For indicating pronunciation in CJK texts (DEPRECATED - used char@style rb)

q.description: Poetry text, level 1 indent (if single level)

q1.description: Poetry text, level 1 indent (if multiple levels)

qac.description: Poetry text, Acrostic markup of the first character of a line of acrostic poetry

qd.description: A Hebrew musical performance annotation, similar in content to Hebrew descriptive title.

qm.description: Poetry text, embedded, level 1 indent (if single level)

qm1.description: Poetry text, embedded, level 1 indent (if multiple levels)

qt.description: For Old Testament quoted text appearing in the New Testament

restore.description: Comment about when text was restored

rq.description: A cross-reference indicating the source text for the preceding quotation.

s.description: A section heading, level 1 (if single level)

s1.description: A section heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)

s3.description: A section heading, level 3 (e.g. Genesis "The First Day")

sc.description: A character style, for small capitalization text

sd.description: Vertical space used to divide the text into sections, level 1 (if single level)

sd1.description: Semantic division location (vertical space used to divide the text into sections), level 1 (if multiple levels)

sd2.description: Semantic division location (vertical space used to divide the text into sections), level 2

sd3.description: Semantic division location (vertical space used to divide the text into sections), level 3

sd4.description: Semantic division location (vertical space used to divide the text into sections), level 4

sig.description: For the signature of the author of an Epistle

sls.description: To represent where the original text is in a secondary language or from an alternate text source

sp.description: A heading, to identify the speaker (e.g. Job)

sr.description: A section division references range heading

sup.description: A character style, for superscript text. Typically for use in critical edition footnotes.

toca1.description: Alternative language long table of contents text

toca2.description: Alternative language short table of contents text

ts.description: Translator's chunk (to identify chunks of text suitable for translating at one time)

usfm.parseUsfmInstructions: If this marker is directly after the first id marker, this marker's version attribute should determine the version attribute of the usx or USJ marker at the top of the USX or USJ document, then this marker should be removed.

va.description: Second (alternate) verse number (for coding dual numeration in Psalms; see also NRSV Exo 22.1-4)

vp.description: Published verse marker - this is a verse marking that would be used in the published text

wj.description: For marking the words of Jesus

xdc.description: Cross-reference target reference(s), Deuterocanon only (DEPRECATED - use char@style dc)

xnt.description: Cross-reference target reference(s), New Testament only

xop.description: Published cross reference origin text (origin reference that should appear in the published text)

xot.description: Cross-reference target reference(s), Old Testament only

xq.description: A cross-reference quotation from the scripture text

xt.description:
A target reference(s)
A cross reference target reference(s)
The cross reference target reference(s), protocanon only

xta.description: Cross reference target references added text

cell.outputToUsfmInstructions: If this marker has a colspan attribute, the USFM marker name should be this marker's name plus hyphen (-) plus the marker's final column number (first column number found in the marker name plus colspan minus 1). Then the colspan attribute should not be output as a USFM attribute.
cell.parseUsfmInstructions: If this marker's name has a hyphen (-) and a number after the marker, the USX/USJ marker name should be just the portion of the marker name before the hyphen, and it should have the colspan attribute which is the number of columns spanned by the marker (second column number plus 1 minus first column number).

figure.outputToUsfmInstructions: The USX/USJ file attribute needs its name changed to src in USFM
figure.parseUsfmInstructions: The USFM src attribute needs its name changed to file in USX/USJ

table:cell.outputToUsfmInstructions: If this marker has a colspan attribute, the USFM marker name should be this marker's name plus hyphen (-) plus the marker's final column number (first column number found in the marker name plus colspan minus 1). Then the colspan attribute should not be output as a USFM attribute.
table:cell.parseUsfmInstructions: If this marker's name has a hyphen (-) and a number after the marker, the USX/USJ marker name should be just the portion of the marker name before the hyphen, and it should have the colspan attribute which is the number of columns spanned by the marker (second column number plus 1 minus first column number).

unmatched.description: Paratext uses this type for closing markers that it cannot find opening markers for. They are treated like char markers but have no contents, no closing markers, and no space after the marker.
unmatched.outputToUsfmInstructions: Do not output a structural space after the opening marker for markers with unmatched type.
unmatched.parseUsfmInstructions: If a closing marker occurs but does not seem to have a matching opening marker, create an unmatched-type marker. There is no structural space after the unmatched-type marker; its end is determined by the asterisk at the end of the marker.

USJ.outputToUsfmInstructions: If this marker is the top-level marker containing all other markers in this document, it should not be directly output to USFM. Instead, if this marker's version attribute is other than 3.0, a new usfm marker with this version attribute needs to be added after the id marker if one is present in the USFM.

usx.outputToUsfmInstructions: If this marker is the top-level marker containing all other markers in this document, it should not be directly output to USFM. Instead, if this marker's version attribute is other than 3.0, a new usfm marker with this version attribute needs to be added after the id marker if one is present in the USFM.
